snippet: Widespread closings of merchants’ shops were an attempt to keep the country’s nonviolent protest movement alive as the government stepped up its attacks on rebel-held areas near Damascus.
abstract: Widespread closings of Syrian merchants’ shops are attempt to keep country’s nonviolent protest movement alive as government steps up its attacks on rebel-held areas near Damascus.

byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: Widespread closings of merchants’ shops were an attempt to keep the country’s nonviolent protest movement alive as the government stepped up its attacks on rebel-held areas near Damascus.

headline.seo: Syrian Merchants Protest by Closing Their Shops
headline.main: Stores Shut in Protest as New Strife Grips Syria
headline.print_headline: Stores Shut In Protest As New Strife Grips Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
